items.question: How does Cocoti work?
items.answer: Cocoti lets you create or join tontines, cagnottes, or collective projects online. Every contribution is recorded, and you can track your funds in real time through the app or web dashboard.

items.question: Do I need an account to contribute?
items.answer: No for public cagnottes: you only need a participation link. Yes for tontines and private projects, to ensure traceability and transparency.

items.question: What happens if a member doesnâ€™t pay in a tontine?
items.answer: Each tontine sets its own rules. In a Cocoti-managed tontine, reminders and tracking are in place. The administrator can replace the defaulting member or adjust the round.

items.question: Which payment methods can I use?
items.answer: Cocoti relies on existing, proven payment services: Wave, Orange Money, bank cards (via Stripe), bank transfers, Sendwave, and Wero.

items.question: Is Cocoti only available in Senegal?
items.answer: Cocoti launches in Senegal, France, and Belgium, with plans to expand to other African countries and their diaspora.
